textBody:
Cape Verde follows a policy of nonalignment and seeks cooperative relations with all friendly states. Angola, Brazil, the People's Republic of China, Cuba, France, Germany, Portugal, Senegal, Russia, South Korea and the United States maintain embassies in Praia.

Cape Verde is actively interested in foreign affairs, especially in Africa. It has bilateral relations with some Lusophone nations and holds membership in a number of international organizations. It also participates in most international conferences on economic and political issues.

Bilateral relations

Andorra

Both countries established diplomatic relations on June 30, 2006.[http://www.mae.ad/en/bilateral-and-consular-affairs/bilateral-affairs]

Angola

Cape Verde signed a friendship accord with Angola in December 1975, shortly after Angola gained its independence. Cape Verde and Guinea-Bissau served as stop-over points for Cuban troops on their way to Angola to fight UNITA rebels and South African troops. Prime Minister Pedro Pires sent FARP soldiers to Angola where they served as the personal bodyguards of Angolan President José Eduardo dos Santos.

Argentina

Both countries established diplomatic relations on July 26, 1975.[http://tratados.mrecic.gov.ar/tratado_ficha.php?id=4132]

Armenia

Both countries established diplomatic relations on 26 February 2007.

Australia

Australia and Cape Verde are represented to each other’s country through their respective embassies in Lisbon, Portugal.[http://dfat.gov.au/geo/cabo-verde/Pages/cabo-verde.aspx]

Canada

Both countries established diplomatic    relations in 1976.[http://www.canadainternational.gc.ca/senegal/bilateral_relations_bilaterales/canada_cabo-verde.aspx?lang=eng]

China

In January 2007, Manuel Inocêncio Sousa, Minister of Infrastructure, Transports and Sea, acknowledged the People's Republic of China's importance to Cape Verde stating:

"China has been a friend of Cape Verde even before it gained independence from Portugal 30 years ago. Bilateral relations have been very good: in 2002, for example, the trade value between our two countries reached US $1.8 million, in Chinese exports of light industry products and miscellaneous goods."

Croatia

Both countries established diplomatic relations on August 19, 1994.[http://www.mvep.hr/en/foreign-politics/bilateral-relations/date-of-recognition-and-establishment-of-diplomatic-relations/][http://www.mvep.hr/en/foreign-politics/bilateral-relations/overview-by-country/cape-verde,60.html]

Cyprus

Both countries established diplomatic relations on May 31, 2000.[http://www.olc.gov.cy/olc/olc.nsf/all/64F97A47A9EF9B3DC22575D70022AD2E/$file/List%20of%20Cape%20Verde.pdf?openelement]

Czech Republic

Czech Republic is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Lisbon, Portugal[https://www.mzv.cz/jnp/en/diplomatic_missions/czech_missions_abroad/index.html][https://www.mzv.cz/lisbon/pt/embaixada_e_consulados_honorarios/index.html]
and an honorary consulate in Praia[https://www.mzv.cz/jnp/en/diplomatic_missions/czech_missions_abroad/cape_verde_consulado_honorario_de.html]. 

Georgia

Both countries established diplomatic relations on January 22, 2010.[http://mfa.gov.ge/MainNav/ForeignPolicy/BilateralRelations/%E1%83%99%E1%83%90%E1%83%91%E1%83%9D-%E1%83%95%E1%83%94%E1%83%A0%E1%83%93%E1%83%94%E1%83%A1-%E1%83%A0%E1%83%94%E1%83%A1%E1%83%9E%E1%83%A3%E1%83%91%E1%83%9A%E1%83%98%E1%83%99%E1%83%90.aspx]

Guinea-Bissau

The Republic of Guinea-Bissau is about 900 km south-east of Cape Verde in coastal West Africa. Both were colonies of the Portuguese Empire and they campaigned together for independence with a plan for unification, but the countries separated after 1980.

Hungary

Hungary is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Lisbon, Portugal[http://www.kormany.hu/en/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade/missions ][https://lisszabon.mfa.gov.hu/eng] and an honorary consulate in Praia.[http://www.kormany.hu/en/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade/missions]

India

After Cape Verde became a Portuguese colony in the 15th century, it became an important transit point for trade routes from Europe to India and Australia. The Embassy of India in Dakar, Senegal is concurrently accredited to Cape Verde. Cape Verde maintains an Honorary Consulate General in New Delhi.

Foreign Minister Jose Brito was the first Cape Verdean minister to visit India in November 2009. Minister of State for Rural Development Sudarshan Bhagat visited Cape Verde in September 2015 as the Prime Minister's Special Envoy. Bhagat invited Cape Verde to send a delegation to attend the third  India Africa Forum Summit. Foreign Minister Tolentini Araujo Jorge led the Cape Verdean delegation to participate in the Summit in New Delhi in October 2015.

Bilateral trade between Cape Verde and India totaled US$4.20 million in 2014-15, declining by 40.72% from the previous fiscal. India exported $1.43 million worth of goods to Cape Verde, and imported $2.77 million. The main commodities exported from India to Cape Verde are drugs, pharmaceuticals, plastic and linoleum products, and man-made fibers.

IBSA provided a grant to refurbish a healthcare Centre in Cape Verde. India provided a line of credit worth $5 million to establish a Technology Park in the country. India donated $50,000 in 2010 to help the Government of Cape Verde to fight dengue fever, and supplied computers for the Government's "A New World" programme in October 2012. Citizens of Cape Verde are eligible for scholarships under the Indian Technical and Economic Cooperation Programme and the Indian Council for Cultural Relations.

A small Indian community resides in Cape Verde.

Indonesia

Indonesia is represented in Cape Verde by its embassy in Dakar.[https://www.kemlu.go.id/dakar/en/Pages/Cape-Verde.aspx]

Israel

Both countries established diplomatic relations in July, 1994.[http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/AboutTheMinistry/Pages/Israel-s%20Diplomatic%20Missions%20Abroad.aspx]

Japan

Both countries established diplomatic relations on July 11, 1975.[http://www.mofa.go.jp/af/af1/cv/page22e_000242.html]

Latvia

Both countries established diplomatic relations on October 21, 1992.[http://www.mfa.gov.lv/en/policy/establishment-and-renewal-of-diplomatic-relations]

Lithuania

Both countries established diplomatic relations on May 28, 1992.[https://urm.lt/default/en/list-of-countries-with-which-lithuania-has-established-diplomatic-relations]

Malta

Both countries established diplomatic relations on March 17, 2016.[http://foreignaffairs.gov.mt/en/Government/Embassy%20Press%20Releases/Pages/Protocol-signed-establishing-diplomatic-relations-between-Malta-and-Cape-Verde.aspx]

Mongolia

Both countries established diplomatic relations on November 19, 1975.[https://web.archive.org/web/20110722215952/http://www.mfat.gov.mn/index.php?optioncom_content&view
article&id70&Itemid
83&lang=en]

Montenegro

Both countries established diplomatic relations on December 17, 2010.[http://www.mvp.gov.me/rubrike/bilateralni-odnosi/Tabela-priznanja-i-uspostavljanja-diplomatskih-odn]

Russia

Russia is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Praia.[http://www.capeverde.mid.ru/][http://www.mid.ru/en/maps/cv/?currentpage=main-country]

Serbia

Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1975.[http://www.mfa.gov.rs/en/foreign-policy/bilateral-issues/96-bilateral-issues/12254-cape-verde]

South Africa

Both countries established diplomatic relations on April 4, 1994.[http://www.dirco.gov.za/foreign/bilateral/capeverde.html]

South Korea
 

Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between the Republic of Korea and Cape Verde is 3 October 1988 and In 2011 Bilateral Trade were Exports $1,140,792 (Machineries, Automobile, Optical Instruments) Imports: $65,166.

Switzerland

Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1980.[https://www.eda.admin.ch/eda/en/home/laender-reise-information/kap_verde/schweiz-kap-verde.html]

Turkey

Turkey is represented in Cape Verde by its embassy in Dakar and an honorary consulate in Praia.[http://www.mfa.gov.tr/relations-between-turkey-and-cape-verde.en.mfa]

Ukraine

Ukraine is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Dakar, Senegal.[http://mfa.gov.ua/en/about-mfa/abroad/embassies/99]

United States

The United States provided emergency humanitarian aid and economic assistance to Cape Verde in the period immediately following Cape Verde's independence, as well as after natural disasters, including a hurricane that struck the island of Brava in 1982, and after a severe volcanic eruption on Fogo in 1995. Cape Verde also is eligible for trade benefits under the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA), and has signed an Open Skies agreement to facilitate air travel safety and expansion. On July 4, 2005, Cape Verde became the third country to sign a compact with the U.S. Government-funded Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC); the five-year assistance package is worth over $110 million in addressing rural economic expansion, infrastructure development, and development of the credit sector.

[https://www.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn/2835.htm]

Vietnam

Both countries established diplomatic relations on July 8, 1975.[http://www.mofa.gov.vn/en/cn_vakv/]

Multilateral Relations

European Union
